title: [Large-Scale] Mobile Application-Based Orthognathic Surgery Patient Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: General comprehension of basic medical terminology and postoperative care
context.additional_context: Conducted as microlearning via mobile apps in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments. Learners, as pre-service/in-service teachers, design and apply patient education scenarios based on advanced expertise

learning_goals: Core knowledge about pre- and post-orthognathic surgery management procedures is acquired through a mobile app with over 90% mastery.
Three or more patient education scenarios are designed and executed using five learning modules of a mobile application.
User satisfaction of over 80% is achieved for educational materials developed through project-based assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
